column6: Oh! I'm so excited & yet so lost!

Once upon a time// in the halls of KK Hospital// the hustle and bustle of the day runs rampant. Conversations of joy// the silence of grief and empathetic reassurance can be heard all throughout the hospital wards.
This story is about a new nurse// called Alice. She just joined the nursing team this year and she is excited to learn
Now// Alice was far from being hailed as the best nurse in the ward. In fact// she often found herself stumbling through her duties and grappling with the complexities of nursing.
Alice. We need help over here!
Alice. Can you help me take more gauze?
Alice!! Has our patient been fed?
Her well-intentioned efforts seemed to always miss the mark// and her colleagues and supervisors were quick to take notice.
Oh no// what am I supposed to do now? Why am I so slow?
How is it possible to get everything done...
However// Alice carries an unwavering determination to improve and learn.
She had chosen nursing not for accolades or recognition// but because she genuinely cared for the patients and wanted to make a difference in their lives.
Alice! Isn't your shift over? Go home and get some rest!

column1: Alice overhearing the berating// and her entering wonderland
column6: Ok I guess I will go home for now// I hope that I have helped the nurses enough today.
Yeah. The juniors this year really aren’
Great?
Haha! It seems like they're talking about my batch! I should listen in for some spicy gossip!
Alice presses her body against the door// ears perked. She wasn't always a nosy girl// but she wanted to hear more of what they were saying.
...and there was this girl who really - like really really - cannot make it..
Oh I know who you’re talking about! That girl kept forgetting basic thing
Yahh! She didnt even know how to prime a peripheral line.. She ended up spilling the saline all over the patient!
The sound of loud cackling can be heard behind the door// as well as the voices of the seniors agreeing and clicking their tongues.
Oh.. huh....

Even though Alice knew that she wasnt the best// she had hoped that maybe// just maybe// twere starting to see her efforts and recognize her potential// but the harsh reality was clear – they still saw her as a burde
Ashamed and embarrassed// Alice places her items on the floor and begins to cry.

column1: Add effect in here -> Hospital change
column6: In her distress// she was oblivious to the fact that she was no longer in KK hospital. However// this experience was going to change her life.

column1: Introduction dialogue for main hub area (wonderland)
column6: OH. MY. DAYS.
How long was I asleep?? I better get back before I get flamed!
Hi// how was your experience in the ward
column9: I am surviving the hell shift

column6: GOOD TO HEAR THAT!
I THOUGHT U SAID YOUR SHIFT WAS GOOD
Welcome to the "lines" area! Feel free to look around as much as you want :D
I learnt from a friend about how to set up a peripheral line! It's so cool// want me to show you?
Phlebitis is very scary~~ I had encountered it once and I didn't know how to deal with it..
But I know how to deal with it now! Let me show you :DD
Do you know what [ Check Upstream ] means?
Tubes get tangled so easily!! But did you know they can cause an alarm in pumps? Let me show you how to resolve them!
BBraun pumps usually get affected by that damn T connector! But I know how to deal with it >:)
Arghh!! I've been so busy today, and I can't finish things on time!!
Do you think you can help me collect the pre-requisites for a CVL line?
Don't worry, I wrote it down on a list for you :)
Don't you hate it when your sterile field gets broken? I know how to resolve it// though.
This room has the final challenge.. I heard it's really tough..
From the looks of it.. I don't think you can do it. Maybe you should try out more minigames!
Everyone that walks through these doors have failed in the final challenge..
But I think you look prepared enough!
I cannot stand the sound of the BBraun alarm!! The moment I hear the alarm// I don't know what to do and I freeze up.
I heard the people inside this room know how to resolve the alarm! (Maybe I should go talk to them...)

column1: Occlusion Minigame Dialogue - Closed Roller Clamp
column6: Oh! There's an alarm from the B-Braun pump. Let's have a look!
First// let's check the error message on the infusion pump.
When the infusion pump shows this error message// it means that the IV fluid is not flowing well into the patient. Let's go fix that.
Click on the back button and release the roller clamp.
Great! Now that the issue is resolved// let's restart the pump.
The error message is usually displayed on the screen itself. Try your best to remember the error message! It will help you in identifying the problem.
Once you feel that you remembered the error message// press the "OK" button to mute the alarm.
Try to mute the alarm as quickly as possible so it does not cause distress to the patient.
When the infusion pump shows this error message// it usually means that something is blocking the flow of the infusion tube.
There are many reasons why this could be happening// such as a kink in the line// wrong 3 way tap configuration// phlebitis// or a clamped t-connnector.
Let's go and check all of them to find the source of the issue.
Yay! We resolved the issue! However// we should still see if there are any other issues.
The alarm is very annoying// can you please deal with it? I'm trying to sleep here!
There are many reasons why the [ PRESSURE HIGH ] error is shown// such as a kink in the line// wrong 3 way tap configuration// phlebitis// or a clamped t-connnector.
In this case, the lines are kinked. Click on the back button and smoothen the line
To smoothen out a line// drag the arrow.
There are many reasons why the [ PRESSURE HIGH ] error is shown// such as a kink in the line// wrong 3 way tap configuration// phlebitis// or a clamped t-connnector.
In this case// it seems that the T-connector is currently clamped// which is causing a pressure build up. Let's unclamp this to resolve the issue.
It seems that the threeway tap is currently not in the current position// which is causing a pressure buildup. Let's turn this to resolve the issue.
It seems that the skin is very red and swollen. I should stop the pump and inform a senior nurse.
Firstly// I think I should remove the T connector.
Next// I should put the BBraun machine on standby.
The spike site seems very red and swollen. I think phlebitis is present! I clamped the T connector and put the pump on standby.
Good call! The skin is indeed very red and swollen// indicating the presence of phlebitis.
Let's stop the IV drip together! To do so// we need to
The skin looks fine.
There are many reasons why the [ PRESSURE HIGH ] error is shown// such as a kink in the line// wrong 3 way tap configuration// phlebitis// or a clamped t-connnector.
In this case, phlebitis is present. The first thing you should do to ensure that phlebitis is present is to go and assess the skin on the skin site.

column1: Instructions to put the BBraun pump on standby
column6: To put the machine on standby// I remember that I have to press the [ OFF ] button.
We will need you to set up a peripheral line for this patient.
Before you start// remember to check the patient information. You can do that by clicking on the clipboard at the top.
To begin// we need to set up the requisities to spike the IV bottle.
You can start to prep by removing the foil from the bottle and clean with an alcohol swab.
Click on the tray to access your items.
Click on the Infusion bottle to remove the foil.
Drag the alcohol swab onto the rubber hub of the bottle to cleanse it.
Good job! Now that the bottle is prepped// you should prep the IV tubing as well.
You can start by clamping the roller clamp. Then// you should remove the protective bag.
Once both steps are done// we can now spike the IV bottle.
Like I told you just now// you have to clamp the roller clamp.
That's the orange thing on the tube.
To spike the bag// we need to remove the protective cap.
Okay! All the preparatory steps are done// so you can spike the IV bottle now.
To spike the bag// we need to drag the IV tubing to the IV bottle to combine them.
What are you doing? Why are you unclamping the spike before you have primed it?
Please clamp the spike before you continue...
Okay! I've spiked the bag// so I am going to hang it on the stand now :D
Nicely done! We just need to prime the line now.
If you recall// we need to squeeze the drip chamber and open the roller clamp to prime the line.
You should squeeze the drip chamber to prime the line.
Oh no! There are some bubbles present in the drip chamber. I should tap it to get rid of them.
You should unclamp the roller clamp to prime the IV tubing
There is liquid on the other end of the tube// so it is sufficiently primed.
Nicely done! We can start up the B Braun machine now.
To start up the BBraun Machine// press the [ ON ] button.
This will start up a short initialisation process// which you will have to wait through.
We should not open the door until we have primed the line// otherwise the alarm will sound if left idle.
To open the door// press the rightmost button and then press the [ UP ] button when prompted.
Drag the parts of the infusion pump into the machine.
Good job! Now that we have added the infusion tube into the pump// we should input the parameters for the pump.
Use the right button to select a parameter to edit// or use the up and down buttons to choose another parameter.
To edit a parameter// use the up and down buttons to edit a digit// and use the left and right button to change which digit you want to edit.
Once you're done// click the [ OK ] button to confirm.
Alternatively// If you want to reset the value back to 0// you can do so with the [ C ] button.
Hmm... I don't think the parameters are correct here.
Remember// use the up and down buttons to edit the digit// and use the left and right button to change which digit you want to edit.
Okay! I added all the parameters for the pump.
Good work! Before we can start the pump// however// we need to connect the pump inside the player.
Remember// you need to wipe the clave// then prime the IV plug// and finally add the IV tubing.
Firstly// you need to wipe the clave. It can be accessed in the patient view.
You need to flush the IV plug to ensure that there are no air bubbles.
Plug the IV tubing into the IV plug.
Remember to start the pump!
Good job! We have set up the peripheral line. Now we need to start the pump.
Press the [ START ] button to start the infusion pump.
What Should i collect?
Look at the list at the bottom left corner!
Good job! You Collected Everything!
We dont need that.
We have enough of those.
Can you help me collect the prerequisite for CVL set up?
Thank you!
oh// ok....
Hey! I want to take a shower// Can I unplug my CVL line?
column9: Sorry but you have to shower with it

column6: You are not supposed to take it out!! Now we have to set up a new CVL line// go and collect all the pre-requisites again.
Oh.. I didn't know that!
Good job!! Always keep in mind that you should never take out the CVL line.

column1: Stoma Bag Deflation - Regular mode information
column6: Welcome to the stoma bag deflation minigame!
In front of you// there is a patient that requires the deflation of their stoma bag.

column1: Stoma Bag Deflation - Fail Case - Leaving halfway while the bag is open
column6: I probably shouldn't leave until i'm done releasing all the air from this.

column1: Stoma Bag Deflation - Bag not ready
column6: Okay// I think the bag is not that full yet.. Let's wait a bit longer.
The bag looks full! Let's deflate it now// shall we?
We have to remove the air now. Drag the arrow slowly// to push all the air out. Be careful not to do it too fast or unwanted contents will spill out.
oh no! it is not sterile now!
what should I do now?
Why did you call me? Stop wasting my time!
Uh oh you need to collect the prerequisite and set up again!
Set up a Sterile field to prepare for CVL Set Up.
Firstly // prepare the sterile field and proceed to open the sterile items
Make sure nothing Unsterile goes into or across the sterile field. Inform me if anything goes wrong! Good Luck!

column1: 6 Stoma Bag Deflation - Regular mode information
column6: Welcome to the stoma bag deflation minigame!
In front of you// there are 6 stoma bag that will slowly inflate//it is ready to deflate when the bean is on it. Remember to do it quick or the bag will explode!
I'll set a timer for 3 minutes// deflate as many bags as possible. Remember not to press on the bags too hard! I'm here to help you if you need it.

column1: 6 Stoma Bag Deflation - Bag not ready
column6: Okay// I think the bag is not full yet.. Let's wait a bit longer.
The bag looks full! Let's deflate it now// shall we?
Time's up!! Good job!
All the bags have exploded!
